feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Development
feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Modify Data in create supplier application in MDG
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a requirement to enhance standard SAP MDG application by calling a custom FPM on click of a button on Create supplier page to populate some data on a custom FPM. User will select a record from the custom popup and I need to pass data into Name and address field to standard one by overwriting programmatically the one which manually entered.

I need to know how to pass data from custom FPM to standard create customer screen/application. 

Steps

 

 

 On click of supplier button I am calling a custom FPM

Custom FPM screen populated


Now I have to select a record from this popup and pass it to standard fields alike name, address, city

entry.title: How to restrict multiple PRT group selection.
entry.content:
Dear Team,

In transaction COR2, we have PRT Group 1, PRT Group 2, PRT Group 3, and PRT Group 4. Each PRT group contains values. When releasing the process order, the user should be able to select only one PRT group.

Please suggest any BAdI or User Exit that can be used to achieve this requirement.

How to restrict multiple PRT group selection.

Advance Thanks

entry.title: External vendor fields: CI_ include or separate append?
entry.content:
Hi all,

short question onbest practices:

How do you handle it when an external vendor needs additional fields in SAP standard structures/tables?

  • Option 1:
    Add the fields to the existing CI_ include next to the customer fields. In our case, it's table KLAH, so we would add the field to CI_KLAH.
  • Option 2:
    Create a separate vendor append (in several places if necessary). In our case, it would be something like /<vendor name space>/AKLAH.

How do you handle this in terms of maintenance, upgrades, and vendor ownership? Is there a published best practice by SAP?

Thanks!

entry.title: Adding Attachments from AL11 to ME22n using custom program
entry.content:
Greetings,

I'm Trying to attach the attachments(PDF's) from AL11 directory to ME22n Transaction, I'm able to attach the file to PO but I cannot open that. below code is used in my program
FORM attach_file_to_po  USING iv_ebeln       TYPE ebeln
                              iv_full_path   TYPE string
                              iv_filename    "type epsfilnam""pfeflname
                       CHANGING cv_error_msg TYPE string.

  DATA: lv_objkey       TYPE sibflporb-instid,
        ls_borident     TYPE borident,
        ls_attachment   TYPE borident,
        lv_doc_type     TYPE soodk-objtp, "so_obj_tp,
        ls_folder_id    TYPE soodk,
        ls_sofm1        TYPE sofm1,
        ls_sood1        TYPE sood1,
        ls_document     TYPE sood4,
        lt_content_bin  TYPE solix_tab,
        lt_content_soli TYPE soli_tab,
        lt_content      TYPE soli_tab, "TABLE OF SOLI, " solix_tab,
        ls_content      TYPE soli, "solix,
        lv_size         TYPE i,
        lv_file_size    TYPE i,
        lt_objhead      TYPE soli_tab,
        ls_objhead      TYPE soli,
        lv_ep_note      TYPE borident,
        lv_object_id    TYPE soodk,    "sofolenti1-object_id,
        lt_hex_content  TYPE solix_tab,
        lv_binfilesize  TYPE i,
        lv_buffer       TYPE xstring,
        ls_solix        TYPE solix,
        ls_soli         TYPE soli,
*        lv_binfilesize  TYPE i,
        lv_objkey_msg   TYPE sibflporb-instid,
        lv_xstring      TYPE xstring,
        lv_file         TYPE string,
        lt_binary       TYPE TABLE OF x255,
        ls_binary       TYPE x255,
        lt_objcont      TYPE soli_tab,
        ls_objcont      TYPE soli.

  DATA: lv_hd_display TYPE sood2.

  " Build object key for PO
  lv_objkey = iv_ebeln.
  CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
    EXPORTING
      input  = lv_objkey
    IMPORTING
      output = lv_objkey.
  " Read file from application server
  PERFORM read_file_from_server USING iv_full_path
                                CHANGING lt_content_bin
                                         lv_binfilesize
                                         cv_error_msg.

  IF cv_error_msg IS NOT INITIAL.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.
  lv_file = iv_full_path.
CALL FUNCTION 'SO_SOLIXTAB_TO_SOLITAB'
  EXPORTING
    ip_solixtab       = lt_content_bin
 IMPORTING
   EP_SOLITAB        = lt_objcont.
 " Determine document type based on extension
  IF iv_filename CS '.pdf' OR iv_filename CS '.PDF'.
    lv_doc_type = 'PDF'.
  ELSEIF iv_filename CS '.xls' OR iv_filename CS '.xlsx' OR
         iv_filename CS '.XLS' OR iv_filename CS '.XLSX'.
    lv_doc_type = 'XLS'.
  ELSEIF iv_filename CS '.doc' OR iv_filename CS '.docx' OR
         iv_filename CS '.DOC' OR iv_filename CS '.DOCX'.
    lv_doc_type = 'DOC'.
  ELSEIF iv_filename CS '.txt' OR iv_filename CS '.TXT'.
    lv_doc_type = 'RAW'.
  ELSE.
    lv_doc_type = 'EXT'.
  ENDIF.

  " Prepare OBJHEAD table - like dialog
  CLEAR ls_objhead.
  CONCATENATE '&SO_FILENAME=' iv_filename INTO ls_objhead-line.
  APPEND ls_objhead TO lt_objhead.

 CLEAR ls_objhead.
  ls_objhead-line = '&SO_FORMAT=BIN'.
  APPEND ls_objhead TO lt_objhead.
  CALL FUNCTION 'SO_FOLDER_ROOT_ID_GET'
    EXPORTING
      region                = 'B'
    IMPORTING
      folder_id             = ls_folder_id
    EXCEPTIONS
      communication_failure = 1
      owner_not_exist       = 2
      system_failure        = 3
      x_error               = 4.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    ls_folder_id-objtp = 'FOL'.
    ls_folder_id-objyr = '99'.
    ls_folder_id-objno = space.
  ENDIF.

  ls_sood1-file_ext = 'PDF'. "lv_doc_type."'PDF'.
  ls_sood1-extct    = 'K'.
  ls_sood1-objdes   = iv_filename.
  ls_sood1-objpri   = '5'.
  ls_sood1-objla    = sy-langu.
  ls_sood1-objlen   = lv_binfilesize.
  " Create attachment using SO_OBJECT_INSERT
  CALL FUNCTION 'SO_OBJECT_INSERT'
    EXPORTING
      folder_id                  = ls_folder_id "'FOL01'
      object_type                = lv_doc_type
      object_fl_change           = ls_sofm1
      object_hd_change           = ls_sood1
    IMPORTING
      object_id                  = lv_object_id
    TABLES
*     objcont                    = lt_content
      objcont                    = lt_objcont "lt_content_soli
      objhead                    = lt_objhead
    EXCEPTIONS
      active_user_not_exist      = 1
      communication_failure      = 2
      component_not_available    = 3
      folder_not_exist           = 4
      folder_no_authorization    = 5
      object_type_not_exist      = 6
      operation_no_authorization = 7
      owner_not_exist            = 8
      parameter_error            = 9
      substitute_not_active      = 10
      substitute_not_defined     = 11
      system_failure             = 12
      x_error                    = 13
      OTHERS                     = 14.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    cv_error_msg = 'Error creating attachment object'.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  DATA lt_tbl1024 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tbl1024.
  DATA lv_xstr TYPE xstring.

  lv_objkey = iv_ebeln.

  CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_OUTPUT'
    EXPORTING
      input  = lv_objkey
    IMPORTING
      output = lv_objkey.


  ls_borident-objkey = iv_ebeln.
  ls_borident-objtype = 'BUS2012'.

  ls_document-foltp = ls_folder_id-objtp.
  ls_document-folyr = ls_folder_id-objyr.
  ls_document-folno = ls_folder_id-objno.
*  ls_document-objtp = lv_object_id-objtp.
  ls_document-objtp = attach_id-objtp.
*  ls_document-objyr = lv_object_id-objyr.
  ls_document-objyr = attach_id-objyr.
*  ls_document-objno = lv_object_id-objno.
  ls_document-objno = attach_id-objno.

  ls_attachment-objkey = ls_document(34).
  ls_attachment-objtype = 'MESSAGE'.

  " Link attachment to PO using BINARY_RELATION_CREATE_COMMIT
  CALL FUNCTION 'BINARY_RELATION_CREATE_COMMIT'
    EXPORTING
      obj_rolea    = ls_borident
      obj_roleb    = ls_attachment
      relationtype = 'ATTA'
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS       = 1.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    cv_error_msg = 'Error linking attachment to PO'.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  COMMIT WORK.

Endform.

entry.title: IDoc port -system port SAPxxx
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

When created IDoc automatically from output type in purchase order that link to Logical system configured.  We noticed that the sender port begin with SAP + xxx (3digits of system name ex. T22) will be SAPT22  is automatic show as sender port. This port we not created in We21 before. pls advise. is this standard system that the system name is there without to create port in WE21.

entry.title: Call derivations on custom event in sap mdg
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a requirement to trigger an api call on click of a button based on address data and name enter for BP creation in SAP MDG.
Derive the data from API and update the address and Name data in BP creation.

How to call the retrieve data by triggering the derivation badi on click of a button or event or any suggested approach ?

Thanks
Vishal

entry.title: Working Report Despite Incorrect Syntax
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

As far as I observed in the report, it should have thrown an error at the inline declaration stage. However, no issues appear when running or activating the report. It also runs without any problems. The variable defined via inline declaration seems to be treated as if it belongs to a different scope. What is the reason for this?

entry.title: Transactional RFC port or XML HTTP port
entry.content:
Hi expert,

we are configured the IDoc integration to another system but has PI/PO as middleware. 

Just wonder how can we know that which sender or receiver port should use transactional RFC port type or XML HTTP port.

entry.title: Dynamic table name in Select * From (Table_name)
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've created on Global Class in SE24, in which I've created the methods as per my requirements, for now I've made it statically that when I call the method it will fetch the corresponding data given in Select statment.

But I want to make it dynamic that while calling that method I can pass the table name as parameter and it will fetch the records for that corresponding table. So, is it possible to do it this way or there is any other way around that im missing?

Thanks.

entry.title: How should a beginner plan ABAP learning for S/4HANA?
entry.content:
I am a beginner in SAP ABAP and currently learning the fundamentals such as reports, internal tables, and basic Open SQL.

Since most systems are now based on S/4HANA, I would like guidance on how to plan my ABAP learning path specifically for S/4HANA.

As a beginner, I am confused about what to focus on first classical ABAP concepts or newer technologies like CDS views, AMDP, and RAP.

Could experienced members please suggest:

A recommended learning sequence for ABAP in the S/4HANA environment

Which modern ABAP concepts are essential for beginners

Any common mistakes beginners should avoid

entry.title: Message Class in one logon language but with multiple translation
entry.content:
Hello SAP Expert, I have a question about there is possible to have transalation in different language in one logon language (EN), I have a case to translate message (se91) example in logon language EN we create message in DE (german) but we need to differentiation of language message class EN and DE in Logon EN. But, we dont touch the source code of the message. Is Possible how to technically do this...

Thanks.

Tedi Ace

entry.title: How to Identify and Report GOS Attachments Linked to SAP Business Objects?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with Generic Object Services (GOS) attachments in SAP and need to identify and report attachments linked to SAP business objects such as accounting documents, purchase orders, or material masters.

I have already explored table SRGBTBREL to identify relationships using fields like:
- TYPEID_A
- INSTID_A
- RELTYPE (ATTA)

However, I am facing challenges in:
1. Identifying attachments across multiple object types (FI, MM, SD)
2. Mapping attachments to specific transactions (e.g. FB03, ME23N)
3. Reporting attachment availability (Yes/No) along with document metadata
4. Understanding differences between GOS, DMS (DRAD), and ArchiveLink storage

Could you please advise:
- Which tables are best suited for GOS attachment reporting?
- How to correctly derive object keys (INSTID_A)?
- Any standard SAP reports, CDS views, or best practices for this requirement?

Any guidance or examples would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
Regards,
Juveria

entry.title: Bapi for tcode : /SAPPCE/DPCK01
entry.content:
Hello experts

Im searching for bapi fm to  create dp chain in tcode : /SAPPCE/DPCK01

Thanks

entry.title: FBE1 automation
entry.content:
Hi,
I'm trying to automate FBE1 with quick capture, but I'm continuosly getting Error 344.
What I'm trying to achieve is really simple:
1. Insert requires fields company code (0001), account type (D) and account number (0000001234).
2. Then add The total amount for the payment advice (e.g. 600.00 EUR) 
3. Add all positions through quick capture (Schnellerfassung) with amount (2x 300EUR) and document number (eg. 1234abcd) 

And finally saving it and returning the the new advice number. Below is my code.
Can someone help me identify where the issue comes from?

 

" ---- start bdc

bdc_dynpro( iv_prog = 'SAPMF06A' iv_dynp = '0100' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_OKCODE' iv_fval = '/00' ).

bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_CURSOR' iv_fval = 'RF06A-BUKRS' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'RF06A-BUKRS' iv_fval = '0001' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'RF06A-KOART' iv_fval = 'D' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'RF06A-KONTO' iv_fval = '0000001234' ).

bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_OKCODE' iv_fval = '=WEIT' ).

" --- Advice Head
bdc_dynpro( iv_prog = 'SAPLFRAD' iv_dynp = '0200' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_CURSOR' iv_fval = 'AVIK-WAERS' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'AVIK-WAERS' iv_fval = 'EUR' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_CURSOR' iv_fval = 'AVIK-WRBTR' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'AVIK-WRBTR' iv_fval = '600.00' ). " conv bdc_fval( iv_total ) ).

" ----- Add positions
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_CURSOR' iv_fval = 'GS_AVIP_FAST_ENTRY-NEBTR(01)' ).

LOOP AT it_positions ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_pos>).
DATA(lv_idx2) = |{ lv_index WIDTH = 2 PAD = '0' ALIGN = RIGHT }|. " '01', '02', ...

bdc_dynpro( iv_prog = 'SAPLFRAD' iv_dynp = '0200' ).

bdc_field( iv_fnam = |GS_AVIP_FAST_ENTRY-BELNR(01)| iv_fval = conv bdc_fval( <ls_pos>-belnr ) ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = |GS_AVIP_FAST_ENTRY-NEBTR(01)| iv_fval = '300.00' ).

bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_OKCODE' iv_fval = '/00' ).

lv_index = lv_index + 1

ENDLOOP.

" ---- saving data
bdc_dynpro( iv_prog = 'SAPLFRAD' iv_dynp = '0200' ).
bdc_field( iv_fnam = 'BDC_OKCODE' iv_fval = '=BU' ).

Data: lt_msg TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bdcmsgcoll.

CALL TRANSACTION 'FBE1'
USING gt_bdc
MODE 'N'
UPDATE 'S'
MESSAGES INTO lt_msg.

entry.title: editable alv report
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have  created an editable alv report on PO.

check this code is fine or not. please let me know.

here is code :

TYPE-POOLS: slis.

TABLES: ekpo.

SELECT-OPTIONS: s_ebeln FOR ekpo-ebeln.


DATA: it_ekpo TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ekpo,
wa_ekpo TYPE ekpo.

DATA: it_fcat TYPE slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
wa_fcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
wa_layo TYPE slis_layout_alv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* START-OF-SELECTION
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

PERFORM get_data.
PERFORM build_fieldcat.
PERFORM display_alv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Get data
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_data.

SELECT *
FROM ekpo
INTO TABLE it_ekpo
UP TO 100 ROWS
where ekpo~ebeln IN s_ebeln.


ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Build field catalog
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_fieldcat.

CLEAR it_fcat.

" EBELN - not editable (key)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 1.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'EBELN'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'PO Number'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" EBELP - not editable (key)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 2.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'EBELP'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Item'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" AEDAT - display only
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 3.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'AEDAT'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Change Date'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" TXZ01 - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 4.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'TXZ01'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Short Text'.
wa_fcat-outputlen = 40.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" MATNR - display only (you can make it editable if needed)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 5.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'MATNR'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Material'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" MENGE - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 6.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'MENGE'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Quantity'.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" NETWR - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 7.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'NETWR'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Net Value'.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

CLEAR wa_layo.
wa_layo-colwidth_optimize = 'X'.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Display ALV
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM display_alv.

CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
i_callback_program = sy-repid
i_callback_user_command = 'USER_COMMAND'
is_layout = wa_layo
it_fieldcat = it_fcat
TABLES
t_outtab = it_ekpo
EXCEPTIONS
program_error = 1
OTHERS = 2.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE 'Error in ALV display' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* USER COMMAND
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM user_command USING r_ucomm TYPE sy-ucomm
r_selfield TYPE slis_selfield.

CASE r_ucomm.

WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'. " Triggered by Save (Ctrl+S) in ALV

PERFORM save_data.

" Refresh ALV after save
r_selfield-refresh = 'X'.

ENDCASE.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Save data: update ALL rows from internal table to EKPO
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM save_data.

" Update all entries based on primary key (EBELN+EBELP)
MODIFY ekpo FROM TABLE it_ekpo.

IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
MESSAGE 'All changed rows saved successfully' TYPE 'S'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
MESSAGE 'Error while updating EKPO' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: editable alv report
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have created editable alv report.

kindly check the code please let me know is this fine code or not.

thankyou.

code:

TYPE-POOLS: slis.

TABLES: ekpo.

SELECT-OPTIONS: s_ebeln FOR ekpo-ebeln.


DATA: it_ekpo TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ekpo,
wa_ekpo TYPE ekpo.

DATA: it_fcat TYPE slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
wa_fcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
wa_layo TYPE slis_layout_alv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* START-OF-SELECTION
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

PERFORM get_data.
PERFORM build_fieldcat.
PERFORM display_alv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Get data
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_data.

SELECT *
FROM ekpo
INTO TABLE it_ekpo
UP TO 100 ROWS
where ekpo~ebeln IN s_ebeln.


ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Build field catalog
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_fieldcat.

CLEAR it_fcat.

" EBELN - not editable (key)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 1.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'EBELN'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'PO Number'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" EBELP - not editable (key)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 2.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'EBELP'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Item'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" AEDAT - display only
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 3.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'AEDAT'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Change Date'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" TXZ01 - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 4.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'TXZ01'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Short Text'.
wa_fcat-outputlen = 40.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" MATNR - display only (you can make it editable if needed)
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 5.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'MATNR'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Material'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" MENGE - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 6.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'MENGE'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Quantity'.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

" NETWR - editable
CLEAR wa_fcat.
wa_fcat-col_pos = 7.
wa_fcat-fieldname = 'NETWR'.
wa_fcat-seltext_l = 'Net Value'.
wa_fcat-edit = 'X'.
APPEND wa_fcat TO it_fcat.

CLEAR wa_layo.
wa_layo-colwidth_optimize = 'X'.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Display ALV
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM display_alv.

CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
i_callback_program = sy-repid
i_callback_user_command = 'USER_COMMAND'
is_layout = wa_layo
it_fieldcat = it_fcat
TABLES
t_outtab = it_ekpo
EXCEPTIONS
program_error = 1
OTHERS = 2.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE 'Error in ALV display' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* USER COMMAND
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM user_command USING r_ucomm TYPE sy-ucomm
r_selfield TYPE slis_selfield.

CASE r_ucomm.

WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'. " Triggered by Save (Ctrl+S) in ALV

PERFORM save_data.

" Refresh ALV after save
r_selfield-refresh = 'X'.

ENDCASE.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Save data: update ALL rows from internal table to EKPO
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM save_data.

" Update all entries based on primary key (EBELN+EBELP)
MODIFY ekpo FROM TABLE it_ekpo.

IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
MESSAGE 'All changed rows saved successfully' TYPE 'S'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
MESSAGE 'Error while updating EKPO' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: Multilevel Hierarchy Tree view using RAP
entry.content:
Hi, my requirement is to create a multilevel hierarchy tree view using RAP. I want to know if it's possible and if yes how to do it.

Level 1
Level 2 Item 1
          Level 3(Item)
          Description: of level 3
          level 3 (item 2)
          Description: of level 3 item 2
Level 2 Item 2
            Level 3 (item 1)
            Description: level 3 item 1 

Again multiple level 1 tabs can be present

 

Please help me with this

entry.title: aggregation of currency coloumn is not happening using annotation@DefaultAggregation: #SUM
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have created custom CDS view entity, I have used the annotation @DefaultAggregation: #SUM to display the total of transaction currency and few more currency fields. I have added the below code in my CDS. when I ran the application, I'm not able to see the aggregation data in the bottom.

 

  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [  { entity:  { name: 'I_CurrencyStdVH', element: 'Currency' }
                                 }]
@UI.fieldGroup: [{ qualifier: '_AMOUNT1_QUANTITY', groupLabel: 'Amount and Quantity Fields', position: 15, exclude: false, importance: #HIGH, type: #STANDARD }]
@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
//@Semantics.currencyCode:true
ac.rwcur as TransactionCurrency,

@UI.fieldGroup: [{ qualifier: '_AMOUNT1_QUANTITY', groupLabel: 'Amount and Quantity Fields', position: 02, exclude: false, importance: #HIGH, type: #STANDARD }]
@ObjectModel.filter.enabled: true
@DefaultAggregation: #SUM
@Semantics: { amount : {currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'} } 
@UI.lineItem: [{position:120}]
ac.wsl as  AmountInTransactionCurrency,

 

I referred the below url to display the total of all currency column.
Annotating Aggregate Functions in CDS | SAP Help Portal

I feel the problem in commenting the below code. 

 

//@Semantics.currencyCode:true

 

If I uncommented the coded I'm getting below error.

"Annotation Semantics.currencyCode is not allowed in view entities."

This because I used the view entity.

May I know what I missed here? and how to resolve the issue?

Thanks,

Dhina.

entry.content:
Hi experts,

Is this possible to call enrichment spot on click of a custom button instead of check button while creating BP.

Thanks

entry.title: SHA 256 & AES 128 conversion issue
entry.content:
Hi All, Please help in this matter.

We are accessing external API via PI/PO in abap program. Please find attached below code for your reference.

TRY.
    CALL METHOD lo_client_proxy->sios_get_token_cnr
      EXPORTING
        output = ls_request " Outbound data (request)
      IMPORTING
        input  = ls_response. " Inbound data (response)

    COMMIT WORK. " Essential for sending the message via XI runtime

* 4. PROCESS the response DATA
    WRITE: / 'Message sent successfully'.
    WRITE: / 'Response received:', ls_response-mt_get_token_resp-access_token.
* ... display or process response fields

* 5. Handle potential system faults (communication errors, etc.)
  CATCH cx_ai_system_fault INTO lo_sys_exception.
    lv_error_text = lo_sys_exception->get_text( ).
    WRITE: / 'Error sending message:'.
    WRITE: / lv_error_text.
ENDTRY.

" Generate a random key using AES-256 algorithm
*CALL METHOD cl_sec_sxml_writer=>generate_key
*  EXPORTING
*    algorithm = cl_sec_sxml_writer=>co_aes128_algorithm
*  RECEIVING
*    key       = random.

" Convert the key to a string format
*lr_conv_key = cl_abap_conv_out_ce=>create( ).
*lr_conv_key->write( data = 'Ip7OADbe73PFqcNG' ).
*e_key = lr_conv_key->get_buffer( ).
cl_abap_conv_out_ce=>create( )->convert( EXPORTING data = 'Ip7OADbe73PFqcNG'
                                         IMPORTING buffer = e_key   ).
i_key_xstring = e_key.

" Convert plain text to xstring
lr_conv_sec = cl_abap_conv_out_ce=>create( ).
i_text = 'cino=' && 'MHAU010092312018'.
*lr_conv_sec->write( data = i_text ).
*lv_xstring2 = lr_conv_sec->get_buffer( ).

cl_abap_conv_out_ce=>create( )->convert( EXPORTING data = i_text
                                         IMPORTING buffer = lv_xstring2   ).

*lr_conv_key->write( data = c_iv ).
*DATA(lv_civ) = lr_conv_key->get_buffer( ).
*lv_string_iv = lv_civ.
*c_iv =
" Encrypt the xstring using AES-256 algorithm
cl_sec_sxml_writer=>encrypt_iv(
  EXPORTING
    plaintext  = lv_xstring2
    key        = i_key_xstring
    algorithm  = cl_sec_sxml_writer=>co_aes128_algorithm
    iv         = i_key_xstring "c_iv "lv_string_iv "c_iv
  IMPORTING
    ciphertext = lv_message ).

" Remove the 16-byte padding before encoding
lr_xstring = lv_message+16.
*lv_xstring = lr_xstring.
*" Encode the result as Base64
CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_BASE64_ENCODE_STR'
  EXPORTING
    input  = lr_xstring
  IMPORTING
    output = e_text_enc.

lv_escaped = cl_http_utility=>escape_url( unescaped = e_text_enc ).

lv_token = ls_response-mt_get_token_resp-access_token.

DATA(lv_binary_key)  = cl_abap_hmac=>string_to_xstring( '15081947' ).

DATA(lv_binary_data) = cl_abap_hmac=>string_to_xstring( i_text ).

DATA: lv_hmac_result  TYPE string.

cl_abap_hmac=>calculate_hmac_for_raw(
  EXPORTING
    if_algorithm     = 'SHA256'
    if_key           = lv_binary_key
    if_data          = lv_binary_data
  IMPORTING
    ef_hmacb64string = lv_hmac_result " Result in Base64
    " ef_hmacxstring  = ...           " Result in XString
).

lv_escaped2 = cl_http_utility=>escape_url( unescaped = lv_hmac_result ).

lv_wa-dept_id = 'CPWD'.
lv_wa-request_str = lv_escaped."lv_xstring.

lv_wa-request_token = lv_escaped2."lv_hash_hex."ls_response-mt_get_token_resp-access_token.
lv_wa-version = 'v1.3'.
lv_wa-authorization = lv_token.
APPEND lv_wa TO ls_request2-mt_e_court_cases_search_by_cnr-request.

CREATE OBJECT lo_client_proxy2.

TRY.
    CALL METHOD lo_client_proxy2->sios_e_court_cases_search_by_c
      EXPORTING
        output = ls_request2 " Outbound data (request)
      IMPORTING
        input  = ls_response2. " Inbound data (response)

    COMMIT WORK. " Essential for sending the message via XI runtime

* 4. PROCESS the response DATA
    WRITE: / 'Message sent successfully'.
    WRITE: / 'Response received:', ls_response-mt_get_token_resp-access_token.
* ... display or process response fields

* 5. Handle potential system faults (communication errors, etc.)
  CATCH cx_ai_system_fault INTO lo_sys_exception.
    lv_error_text = lo_sys_exception->get_text( ).
    WRITE: / 'Error sending message:'.
    WRITE: / lv_error_text.
ENDTRY.

 Expected lv_wa-request_str  is "1AkiXC/440H1GtQRsLj4diLKTgc/2uX5ENWfvMEV/A0=", but I am getting half correct value i.e. "1AkiXC%2f440H1GtQRsLj4dn6iStyCEwp%2bVbFjxHtJEeM%3d". logic for this is ($encrypt=openssl_encrypt($input_str, 'AES-128-CBC', $ authentication
_key, 'OPENSSL_RAW_DATA', $iv);
$request_str = base64_encode($encrypt);
$request_str=urlencode($request_str); )

Also not sure whether lv_wa-request_token value  (SHA256)is correct. logic is as follows(
$input_str="court_number=1|causelist_date=2019-04-15|est_code=MHAU01
|ci_cri=2"; $request_token = hash_hmac('sha256', $input_str,"15081947").

Thank you in advance.

Regards,
Darshan
